input_text:
Job Title: Financial Analyst

Location: Raleigh-Durham-Chapel Hill Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Analyst, Finance

Description:
We hire happy people!Delta Dental of North Carolina is looking for a Financial Analyst to join our growing finance team. We are the fastest growing Delta Dental in the country, and we will continue to execute our growth strategy into the future. Our corporate culture produces a uniquely positive work environment. We are looking for a new associate who is happy, willing to learn and enthusiastic about improving the oral health and overall well-being of the communities we serve. Our associates make up a team of highly talented individuals who seamlessly provide dental and vision insurance benefits to individuals and employer groups throughout North Carolina. If you are looking for your next exciting opportunity, come join us!
Essential Duties/Responsibilities:Creates monthly management reporting package with financial statements and supporting documentation and analysis. Prepares necessary documents for Board of Director and Finance Committee meetings and reporting to outside partners.Assists with the development of the annual budget and ongoing forecasts for departments and affiliates.Maintains financial reporting systems for financial reporting, budgeting and forecasting.Analyzes, interprets and communicates cost and expense variances to management. Works with management to contain costs and forecast expenses.Compiles cost accounting reports and analyses and generates cost projections in support of the Company and Enterprise.Compiles and prepares information for tax and regulatory reporting filings.Provides financial expertise to management and affiliates by creating and presenting ad-hoc reports and analyses.
Position Requirements:Education and Experience:Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or related fieldFive years of experience with financial reporting and analysisCertified public accountant (CPA) designation preferred.Will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience.
Other Skills/Abilities:Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Office products including Excel, Outlook, Word and PowerPointStrong analytical skillsExperience with budgeting, forecasting and financial reportingAbility to communicate verbally and in writing with internal and external contacts as well as mid to senior level managementAbility to use independent judgement and to resolve complex problems

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Financial Analyst
output_json.summary: Delta Dental of North Carolina seeks a Financial Analyst to join its finance team.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or related field
tools_and_technologies: Microsoft Office products (Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)
soft_skills: Experience with budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting
Ability to communicate verbally and in writing
job_responsibilities: Creates monthly management reporting package with financial statements and supporting documentation and analysis.
Assists with the development of the annual budget and ongoing forecasts for departments and affiliates.
Maintains financial reporting systems for financial reporting, budgeting, and forecasting.
Analyzes, interprets, and communicates cost and expense variances to management.
Works with management to contain costs and forecast expenses.
Compiles cost accounting reports and analyses and generates cost projections.
Compiles and prepares information for tax and regulatory reporting filings.
Provides financial expertise to management and affiliates by creating and presenting ad-hoc reports and analyses.
